com.enterprise_architecture.essential.importutility.service
Class XmlImportService

java.lang.Object
  javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
          com.enterprise_architecture.essential.importutility.service.XmlImportService
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
public class XmlImportService
extends javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet

Servlet that provides a REST Service interface to the Import Utility, enabling XML Import Activities to be invoked automatically.

Import Activities, Import Specifications (the semantic mapping of source data to the Essential Meta Model, defined via XSL transforms) and Target Environments must all be configured in the Import Utility web-based, graphical user interface. The service interface provides a REST-based HTTP approach for invoking imports by selecting the Import Activity and Target Environment in a request that includes the source data to import.

Supported source data formats:

  • XML documents

An import activity may take several minutes to complete. Therefore, the service supports a long-running process by accepting a callback URL to which final success / failure messages are sent. On request, the parameters are evaluated and any immediate problems are reported (e.g. invalid import activity). The service responds with an HTTP 201 (Accepted) message if all the request parameters are found to be valid and the request has been accepted for processing. The service receives the following parameters on the request /service:

  • activity - the name of the import activity to use
  • environment - the name of the target environment in which to import
  • uid - the user ID for the client requestor. This must be a valid user account within the import utility
  • pwd - the password for the user account.
  • publish - a boolean flag (yes / no) specifying whether the Import Utility should publish the resulting repository to the target Essential Viewer environment when the import has completed successfully.
  • source - the source XML document to import
  • response - (optional) a URL on the consumer side providing a callback for success / failure messages

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jonathan W. Carter
See Also:
Serialized Form

doPost

protected void doPost(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest theRequest,
                      javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse theResponse)
               throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                      java.io.IOException
Receive requests to the service.

An import activity may take several minutes to complete. Therefore, the service supports a long-running process by accepting a callback URL to which final success / failure messages are sent. On request, the parameters are evaluated and any immediate problems are reported (e.g. invalid import activity). The service responds with an HTTP 201 (Accepted) message if all the request parameters are found to be valid and the request has been accepted for processing. The service receives the following parameters on the request /service:

  • activity - the name of the import activity to use
  • environment - the name of the target environment in which to import
  • uid - the user ID for the client requestor. This must be a valid user account within the import utility
  • pwd - the password for the user account.
  • publish - a boolean flag (yes / no) specifying whether the Import Utility should publish the resulting repository to the target Essential Viewer environment when the import has completed successfully.
  • source - the source XML file (.xml)
  • docname - (optional) the name of the worksheet to use when receiving XML. Default value is 'xmlDoc1'
  • response - (optional) a URL on the consumer side providing a callback for success / failure messages

Overrides:
doPost in class javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException
java.io.IOException

getLocalFileName

protected java.lang.String getLocalFileName(java.lang.String theFilename)
Find or build a filename for the received source content. If one is supplied use that as the main part of the filename, otherwise create one using the default prefix.

Parameters:
theFilename - the name that was supplied.
Returns:
the filename that will be stored, including a timestamp-based suffix to ensure that filename do not clash between requests

saveSourceContent

protected java.lang.String saveSourceContent(java.util.zip.ZipInputStream theZippedInStream,
                                             java.lang.String theFilename)
Save the specified source content document in the input folder

Returns:
the name of the file that was saved, empty string on error

saveSourceContent

protected java.lang.String saveSourceContent(org.apache.commons.fileupload.FileItem theUncompressedItem,
                                             java.lang.String theFilename)
Save a received XML document - to the processing queue folder

Parameters:
theUncompressedItem - the XML document to process
theFilename - the name of the file to use
Returns:
the name of the file that was saved, empty string on error.

saveSourceContent

protected java.lang.String saveSourceContent(java.lang.String theUncompressedXML,
                                             java.lang.String theFilename)
Save a received source content in XML format, saving it to the queue folder

Parameters:
theUncompressedXML - the XML file in uncompressed format in a plain String.
theFilename - the filename to be used to store the converted XML in the queue.
Returns:
the name of the file that was saved or empty string on error

getJobQueueFilename

protected java.lang.String getJobQueueFilename(java.lang.String theFilename,
                                               java.lang.String theFileSuffix)
Build and return a filename in the queue folder that should be used to queue a source file for import

Parameters:
theFilename - the local name of the file to queue - typically that specified by the client request
theFileSuffix - the file suffix to use, defaults to ".xml"
Returns:
the real path to the file in the queue
See Also:
DEFAULT_QUEUE_FILE_SUFFIX

getJobQueueFilename

protected java.lang.String getJobQueueFilename(java.lang.String theFilename)
Build and return a filename in the queue folder that should be used to queue a source file for import

Parameters:
theFilename - the local name of the file to queue - typically that specified by the client request
Returns:
the real path to the file in the queue with the default file suffix, defined by DEFAULT_QUEUE_FILE_SUFFIX
See Also:
DEFAULT_QUEUE_FILE_SUFFIX

getImportController

protected XmlImportServiceImpl getImportController()
Find the Singleton Controller object - creating a new one if one is not already available. Newly created Singletons are held in the Application variable 'controller'

Returns:
a reference to the ImportServiceImpl Controller Singleton object that manages all requests and performs the import processes.

getImportController

protected XmlImportServiceImpl getImportController(boolean theIsCreate)
Get a reference to the Service controller but depending on the value of theIsCreate parameter, the method will not create the controller if it is not already available.

Parameters:
theIsNoCreate - true to force the creation of the controller false to return the controller or NULL if it has not been created
